description.value:
Trigger The kyokor moves at least 60 feet

Effect The ground shakes in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:120] from the kyokor's space.

The ground becomes difficult terrain, and creatures on it are @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.Clumsy]{Clumsy 2} for 1 round. Ground vehicles move at half speed.

Fissures open above underground spaces (like sewers, sinkholes, or catacombs). Creatures in the area tumble into the resulting 40-foot-deep hole unless they succeed at a @Check[reflex|dc:40] save. Near a body of water, these tremors creates dangerous waves. Creatures in the water or within 60 feet of the waterline are struck by waves that deal @Damage[3d8[bludgeoning]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:35|basic] save). On a critical failure, a creature is instantly swept 60 feet out to sea and 60 feet under the water's surface.

details.description:
The footsteps of a kyokor (or other kaiju) shake the ground, causing the earth around it to tremble as though from a powerful earthquake.

When a kyokor passes by or through a settlement—or even attacks!—it leaves a trail of destruction that can be represented by the following hazards.

Terrifying, skyscraper-sized beasts roam the wastelands of Daimalko. Called colossi by the population, these monsters erupted from deep within the earth to stomp cities into dust, decimating the population and destroying every surface civilization on the planet in a terrifying Awakening. Kyokors are among the most dreaded colossi. There's no hope of defeating one without a valko—a war machine created by Daimalko's stubborn survivors to fight the colossi.
details.disable: @Check[athletics|dc:39] (trained), @Check[civil-engineering-lore|dc:39] (trained), or @Check[crafting|dc:39] (trained) to brace a small structure or surface to cancel the effects of the quake in that area, @Check[arcana|dc:41] (legendary), @Check[occultism|dc:41] (legendary), or @Check[performance|dc:41] (legendary) to calm or divert the kyokor; three total successes are required to disable the hazard; @Check[piloting|dc:30] (trained) if in a vehicle to avoid the kyokor's path (disables the hazard only for that vehicle)
details.reset: The kyokor (or other kaiju) doesn't move this way again for [[/gmr 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.
